text: Anyone knows, why in peer logs(network of 4 peers, pbft) would be getting these messages(only for peer 2,3), however the chaincode processes corresponding to these peers are working fine: vp2_1  | 08:30:12.261 [peer] handleChat -> ERRO 142 Error handling message: Peer FSM cannot handle message (DISC_GET_PEERS) with payload size (0) while in state: created

Hyperledger is an Open Source project. IBM is giving support if you use the Blockchain Bluemix service running Hyperledger (infrastructure), gives training sessions, can help developing a PoC via IBM Blockchain&Bluemix garages over the World. Some IBMers are part of Ecosystem & Developers and give workshops or conference at different events (Meetups,Devoxx,InterConnect,etc...)

text: Hi there: simple question regarding the JS api: what should be used to connect to hyperledger fabric: hfc or ibm-blockchain-js?
<@U3PJSQL92> HFC as support for ibm-blockchain-js has been phased out with v1.0
Hi and I am under the assumption that  this Hyperledger Fabric Client also is capable of connecting to the IBM Bluemix blockchain service. Is that correct?
<@U3PJSQL92>  yes, you should be able to do this.  E.g. see this documentation on Bluemix   <https://console.ng.bluemix.net/docs/services/blockchain/etn_sdk.html>
